name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon®
description: Eastern Europe, 2008. War has broken out on the borders of Russia and the fate of the world hangs in the balance. That's when the call goes out for the Ghostsan elite handful of specially trained Green Berets, armed with the latest technology and trained to use the deadliest weapons.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® 2000/XP (only)                     Processor: 450 MHz Pentium® 2 or equivalent                     Memory: 128 MB                     Graphics: 16 MB DirectX®-compliant 3D card (see supported list*)                     DirectX Version: DirectX 8.0 or higher (included)                     Sound: DirectX 8-compliant sound card                     Hard Drive: 1 GB                     *Supported Video Cards at Time of Release: ATI® Rage 128 and RADEON® chips, Intel® 82810 or higher, Matrox Parhelia™, NVIDIA® TNT2 and GeForce™ chips, S3 Pro Savage and UniChrome                     Laptop versions of these chipsets may work but are not supported. These chipsets are currently the only ones that will run this game.

reviews.review_text: An amazing game i remember playing this years ago when i was just a kid on the xbox original my dad completed the entire campaign on elite setting with just one soldier i must have finished it about a bunch of times on veteran. Whenever i play this game it gives me memories of so long ago, the gameplay is just awesome so realistic in a fun way one shot and your dead, commanding your teams, hiding in the bushes with a sniper rifle i could play this game over and over it just never seems to get old one of my favourite games of all time :)

Great classic. Still fun to play. Brings back lots of memories. Not complaining about the graphics.  It's a one-shot-one-kill game.  If you complain about the enemy AI killing you then think about this:  If you were a terrorist with a weapon, wouldn't you shoot anybody on sight?  And I'm assuming real-life terrorists have weapons experience, so the AI in this game should too.  My only downsides:  -Menu resolution (Can't be changed) -Multiplayer is not fully functional -Button mapping (takes a while changing the buttons)
Despite its age this makes for an excellent co-op game with some friends.  Wouldn't really suggest playing it through by yourself though due to the team AI being somewhat lacking.
Had this game growing up on original Xbox, loved the tough one shot kills. I wish you could move a little faster and have better squad control but it's a classic for sure.
Military simulation at its best, a tactical masterpiece.

This game is for people who won't judge it by its graphics but on how the gameplay is and how it works. I played this when I was younger and I can honestly say that this is a lot better than the newer ones, not saying the newer ones aren't good I just prefer this one. First off if you go in thinking that this is going to be like Call of Duty you can't be any more wrong. Essentially this is based on how you build your 6-man army, you will die in a max of 3-4 hits if you're lucky usually you'll die in one hit along with your enemies. If even one of your character dies you can call it game over because you might need that extra sniper of demolitions, and make every shot count because you can miss pretty easily though.

Cool old game! If you have issues with Screen flickering, try setting FULLSCREEN to FALSE in options.xml(Open with Notepad). Cleared up the flickering graphics for me on Win10. you will find the option.xml at steam apps/common/Ghostrecon <FullScreen>FALSE</FullScreen>

This is a game I always come back to. I used to spend hours with my friend in america just playing this game. It's old school graphics but high res and very smooth regardless of what spec your pc is. The playablilty is awesome, and very addictive. Use with both expansions (Desert Siege + Island Thunder) to get the full load out, then you're laughing. If you have friends that like shooters, get them on and play. Co-op for me, but deathmatch is also very involved and a good laugh.
Lots of great memories:) get it for old times sake!

A game that was set in the future with guns that were obsolete when the game was made. A game where being able to see further than your foreskin was not important despite being gibbed by AI snipers and machinegunners on the other side of the map. A game where being able to tell if a person is an enemy or on your team was nigh-impossible because by the time he came out of the fog of war, you were already dead if he was an enemy, or dead anyway because he didnt know if you were an enemy or not either. Also if the fog density wasn't bad enough, theyre was foggy levels dedicated to you being completely blind for an hour.  The best ♥♥♥♥ing shooter of all time. The best ♥♥♥♥ing multiplayer of all time. The best ♥♥♥♥ing expansions of all time. The best ♥♥♥♥ing fog award of all time.

They don't make things like they used to. These were the days when Tom Clancy's name on a box meant quality and realism. The graphics haven't held up, but the story and the gameplay are still as tight as ever. You command two fireteams of three commandos inserted deep into enemy territory. Maps are open and you are far out numbered. It requires planning and patience and rewards you with a statisfaction far greater than that of modern hand holding FPS's.

To this day, GR1 is still one of my favorite tactical shooters of all time. It stands alongside SWAT 4 and Rainbow Six 3 as one of the best blends of action and realism you will ever play. If you've only played GRAW, you're missing out.

The mother of all tactical shooters is still here. Okay, the graphics might not be 2014 but that's about the only (questionable) argument there is about this game. To us it still looks good enough anyway :-)  If you really like to play tactical coop, this game is a must.   Runs on win8.1 and is available as digital download via Steam.

The bottom line is that the original Ghost Recon remains as the best release in the entire series.  The game shines in the non-linear, non-restrictive gameplay that has plagued many linear corridor shooters (to include Ghost Recon Future Soldier). Players have a map, and a team of men, and must apply critical thinking through mission analysis in order to be successful.   The game also has an outstanding damage model that still outshines most shooters; A single 5.56mm round will kill, and players can sustain arm and leg wounds that affect their ability to shoot and move. Third person animations also reflect player damage in the form of limping and visible blood stains and gunshot wounds.  There is also an RPG-like system that allows players to develop their Ghosts and apply personal attributes that will improve their performance.   My only big gripe is the use of a reticule system instead of a first person weapon. Unlike Ravenshield, there is no on-screen, first person weapon. There are only a series of recitules that can be zoomed in to simulate weapon sights.

I really recommend this game! Though it's one of the 'Golden Oldies,' this game provides the action and challenge of the modern day soldier. The enemy is as clever as though it's a real person playing against you! Also, your teammates can think for themselves whether or not to shoot, and when to stay in recon mode. The teamates have excellent leadership skills, too! As for Multiplayer, servers don't exist anymore. However, if you have a friend who also plays Ghost Recon, it is fun to host a server and play with them! Though an individual ordering system isn't available, group-ordering has never been easier! Teammates choose the shortest road when given orders to assault or suppress, and choose the safest road when given orders to go 'Recon.' A cool part is that the team-leaders show signs with their arms and hands when giving orders, instead of talking! This may be the first Ghost Recon, it may not be as advanced as 'Future Warfighter,' and it may not show a gun on 'First-Person View,' but it's still an investment that is not bad to make! My opinion: Buy the game! 'Long Live Tom Clancy!'
Great game! I owned it back when it was new and got many hours of enjoyment from it. Then I saw it the other day on a Steam sale and am now enjoying it again.

This is one of the most difficult games I have ever played. It's pure trial and error. The entire game is a pixel hunt, even if you're a sniper. You will develop eye strain trying to find the small group of 10 pixels that just killed your teammate from halfway across the map. That being said, the game is very rewarding for those who can figure out the correct order of objectives and the 'sweet spots' where you can shoot the enemy but the enemy can't shoot you.

With the Heroes Unleashed mod this game is infinitely replayable due to the 'Black Ops' mission mode which uses a random mission generator to have different objectives every time you play.  Alongside the Arma series, this is the greatest tactical shooter ever made. The mod updates AI and a huge variety of tweaks that sets it lightyears above vanilla.   Seriously, get this game 10/10
